page.title: 06Allotments continued
page.content: The first club,{The Institute,}was built in{Church Road}for Â£1000 in 1923. Two adjoining houses were bought and converted for the clubhouses.Other land was acquired and laid out for sport - soccer,cricket,bowls and tennis, and the{Pavilion}was built. Some of the farmland was sold and the {Wiclif Way}housing estate was built on it. Today 285 plots are still cultivated though it can take years to obtain a plot. During the{1926 strike}Â£700 was paid out in food vouchers, the membership then being 2,000. In recent times membership has been frozen at 4,500. With the coming of bigger buildings it has been opened again with an average 100 applications per fortnight.
